metadata.title: CVE-2021-29976 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in code sharedbetween Firefox and Thunderbird. Some of these bugs showed evidence ofmemory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of thesecould have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affectsThunderbird < 78.12, Firefox ESR < 78.12, and Firefox < 90.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
